alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 4:56PM CDT until April 08 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring but moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM CDT Monday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 04/13/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening.
